title: Noah's Purpose: Evacuation of Fish-Man Island
summary: A theory that Noah was built to evacuate the citizens of Fish-Man Island to the surface when a great disaster occurs, similar to the biblical Noah's Ark.
fullText: Fans theorize that the ancient weapon Poseidon's true purpose is not destruction but salvation. Noah was constructed during the Void Century as a massive evacuation vessel that could be pulled by Sea Kings under Poseidon's command. The 'Promised Day' that King Neptune mentions would be when Fish-Man Island faces destruction, and Poseidon (Shirahoshi) would use her powers to command the Sea Kings to pull Noah to the surface, fulfilling Joy Boy's promise to help the fish-men migrate to the surface world and live alongside humans.
author: Various One Piece Fans

title: Noah as a Weapon Against the World Government
summary: A theory that Noah is intended to be used as a massive weapon, with Sea Kings pulling it into battle against the World Government.
fullText: Some fans theorize that Noah's true purpose is military rather than humanitarian. The ship, pulled by a team of Sea Kings under Poseidon's command, would serve as a devastating weapon against the World Government. A gigantic ark crewed by fish-men and pulled by sea kings sailing into battle would be as deadly a weapon as could be imagined. This theory suggests Joy Boy's promise was to help the fish-men take revenge against surface dwellers who oppressed them during the Void Century.
author: Various One Piece Theorists

source.title: What is the Purpose of Noah and Poseidon? - MangaHelpers

title: Luffy as the New Joy Boy Will Fulfill the Promise
summary: A theory that Luffy, as the new Joy Boy, will work with Shirahoshi (Poseidon) to fulfill the ancient promise regarding Fish-Man Island and Noah.
fullText: Many fans speculate that Luffy represents the reincarnation or successor of Joy Boy. The theory suggests that Luffy will eventually help Shirahoshi use her Poseidon powers to command the Sea Kings to pull Noah, finally fulfilling the promise that Joy Boy made but failed to keep hundreds of years ago. This would result in the fish-men successfully migrating to the surface and achieving equality with humans, which aligns with Queen Otohime's dream and represents the completion of a centuries-old story arc.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: Luffy, Joy Boy and the Greatest War - One Piece Theory

title: Red Line Destruction and Noah's Role in the World Flood
summary: A theory that Noah will be used during a great world flood after the Red Line is destroyed, serving a similar purpose to the biblical Noah's Ark.
fullText: Following Vegapunk's revelation about a coming great flood, fans theorize that Noah's purpose is tied to this apocalyptic event. The theory suggests that when the Red Line is destroyed (possibly by the ancient weapons), the world's oceans will unite and sea levels will rise dramatically. Noah would then serve as a massive refuge ship, pulled by Sea Kings to save both fish-men and humans from drowning. This would explain why the ship is so enormous and why it's called Noah - it's literally meant to be the One Piece world's version of Noah's Ark. The destruction of the Red Line would also destroy both Mariejoa and Fish-Man Island, making evacuation necessary.
author: One Piece Theory Community
